Description: Body sherd of Attic black-figured pottery vessel, possibly a lekanis lid; interior: to the centre, series of bands and lines fired red-brown; glazed black to the outside; exterior: black-figure decoration consisting of female figure (hair, neck, and shoulder remaining; added white triangles and added red on peplos; white dots around edge of sleeve).
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Fitzwilliam Museum, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
The sherd probably belongs to the same vase as Cambridge Fitzwilliam GR.113.1899; if so, it can be attributed to the Burgon Group (Beazley (1956), 'Attic Black Figure Vase Painters', p. 89, no. 3).
Bibliographic references: Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 340, no. B411)
CVA Cambridge II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum: Great Britain, Fascicule 11, Cambridge, Fascicule 2 (p. 39, pl. XX, no. 6)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.2104)
